data.title: Obituaries: January 24, 2023
data.meta_description: Editor’s note: Obituaries are published free of charge as a public service. Content is subject to editing for parity treatment and style continuity. Date of publication cannot be guaranteed. Any questions regarding obituaries should be directed to the mortuary or via email to obituaries@westhawaiitoday.com. Memorial advertisements may be purchased through the newspaper advertising department.
data.text:
Editor’s note: Obituaries are published free of charge as a public service. Content is subject to editing for parity treatment and style continuity. Date of publication cannot be guaranteed. Any questions regarding obituaries should be directed to the mortuary or via email to obituaries@westhawaiitoday.com. Memorial advertisements may be purchased through the newspaper advertising department.

^

Rosemary Cabada

Rosemary “Tootsie” Cabada, 84, of Mountain View, died Dec. 8, 2022 at Hilo Medical Center Friends may call on Jan. 28 at Dodo Mortuary Chapel, visitation from 4 to 6 p.m.; memorial services at 6 p.m. She is survived by husband, Victor Cabada of Mountain View; daughter, Melissa (Brian) Amador of Pepeekeo; son, Wade (Robin) Amador of Mountain View; brother, Paul (Vera) Devera of La Mesa, California; sister in-law, Susan Maluo Devera of Hilo; seven grandchildren and eight great-grandchildren; numerous nieces, nephews and cousins. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

^

Gilbert Bartolome

Gilbert Tagalicud Bartolome, 52, of Pahoa, died Nov. 3, 2022 at Hilo Medical Center. Born May 7, 1970, in Hilo, he worked for a security company in Hawaii. Friends may call Jan. 28 at Dodo Mortuary chapel, visitation from 9 to 10:30 a.m.; funeral services at 10:30 a.m. Casual attire. Burial at Homelani Memorial Park (Ilima Section). He is survived by daughter, Jaymin Bartolome of Honokaa; mother, Estrella Bartolome of Pahoa; sister, Marylou Bartolome of Hilo and Elisa Manning of Pahrump, Nevada; numerous aunts, uncles, cousins, nieces and nephews. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Mildred Morimoto

Mildred Mitsuko Morimoto, 93, of Kailua-Kona, died Sept. 3, 2022 at Nilda’s Care Home. Born in Kealakekua, Hawaii on April 25, 1929, she was a laundry technician for Shiraki Dry cleaners. She was a secretary for General Appliance and Furniture and the Gas Company. She was a member of Hanei Kumi and Kona Hongwanji Buddhist Temple. Private services were held. She is survived by her sons, Reg (Brenda) Morimoto of Kailua-Kona and Melvin (Edith) Morimoto of Captain Cook; brother, Edwin (Margie) Fujimoto of Captain Cook; three grandchildren; numerous nieces and nephews. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary

James Hanano

James Nobuichi Hanano, 93, of Kapaau, Hawaii died on Dec. 26, 2022 at North Hawaii Community Hospital. Born in Kohala, Hawaii on July 14, 1929, he worked at Kohala Sugar Hawaii and retired from Hawaii Preparatory Academy. He was a scoutmaster for Boys Scouts of America and served in the Hawaii National Guard; and was a member of St. Augustine’s Episcopal Church. He is survived by his sons, Jason (Stephanie) Hanano of Hawi and Keven (Cynthia) Hanano of Lihue, Kauai; daughter, Jennifer (John) Colson of Kapaau and Kaky (Geoy) Purdy of Kamuela; 11 grandchildren; 10 great grandchildren; 1 great-great grandchild; numerous nieces and nephews. Private services were held. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

^

Mildred Nakanishi

Mildred Tomiko Nakanishi, 100, of Hilo, passed away at Hale Anuenue Restorative Care Center on Dec. 23, 2022. Born in Kapoho, she retired from Spivey’s Hilo Airport Flower Shop and was a member of Honpa Hongwanji Hilo Betsuin.

She is survived by brothers, Norman Nishiura of Honolulu, Hideo (Betty) Nishiura of Hilo; sisters, Takako Desaki of Honolulu, Sadako Aburamen of Hilo; sister in laws, Matsue Nishiura of Hilo, Gladys Nishiura of Hilo, in addition to nieces and nephews.

Private Service held. No flowers or koden.

Arrangements by Ballard Family Mortuary.

Robert Lower

Robert Alan Lower, 72 of Mountain View, died Nov. 13, 2022 at Hilo Medical Center. Born Nov. 2, 1950, in California, he was a biological science technician for the USDA – Ag Research Service Pacific Basin Agricultural Research Center and a U.S. Army veteran. A celebration of life will be held at a later date. He is survived by wife, Maria Moreno of Mountain View; daughter, Maggie Lower; sisters, Kathy Todd and Sheryl Buncy; brother, Jim Lee; and five grandchildren. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Pastor Robert Noah Sr.

Pastor Robert Loio Noah Sr., 69, of Waimea, died Jan. 5, 2023 at his resident. He was a professional truck driver, CB Radio user. Private services. He is survived wife, Claudia Noah; children, Robert (Hilary) Noah Jr., Victoria (Brad) Kaono, Catherine (David) Noah, Jason (Shaunie) Noah; grandchildren, Courtney Noah and Mellissa Noah; sister, Kathleen Rapoza; brother, Steven Noah; 23 grandchildren and 26 great-grandchildren. Condolences may be sent to Claudia Noah in care of Alpha and Omega Church of God, 64-5305 Puanuanu Place, Kamuela, HI 96743. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Dolores Cabutihan

Dolores Valmoja Cabutihan, 73, of Papaikou, died Oct. 22, 2022, at home. Born in Waialua, Oahu, she was a professional cake decorator and office assistant for the former Edsung Foodservice Co. Friends may call at 5:30 p.m. Feb. 7, 2023 at Mililani Mortuary-Waipio Mauka Chapel on Oahu for a 6:30 p.m. service. Friends may call again from 8:30 a.m. Feb. 8, 2023 at Mililani Mortuary-Waipio Mauka Chapel for a 9:30 a.m. service. Burial follows 11 a.m. at Mililani Memorial Park-Waipio. Family requests casual attire be worn. She is survived by sons, Mark (Luvine) Valmoja of Wahiawa, Oahu, Milton (Terry) Valmoja of Papaikou, Ben Rubonal of Waialua, Oahu; daughter, Ellen (Gerod) Serafin of Fort Mill, South Carolina; sisters, Florida (Nicomedas) Manglallan of Waialua, Oahu, Anna (Dennis) Bates of Tooele, Utah, Aggie (Reginald) Carillo of Waialua, Oahu, June (Abraham) Deuz of Waialua, Oahu; 11 grandchildren, 10 great-grandchildren, numerous nieces and nephews. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Nobuko Mimaki

Nobuko “Gere” Mimaki, 90, of Hilo, died Dec. 12, 2022, at Legacy Hilo Rehabilitation &Nursing Center. Born in Hilo, she was a retired Waiakea Elementary School teacher and member of Honpa Hongwanji Hilo Betsuin, Buddhist Women’s Association, Hawaii State Teachers Association-Retired and National Education Association. Friends may call at 10 a.m. Jan. 31 at Honpa Hongwanji Hilo Betsuin, 398 Kilauea Ave. for an 11 a.m. service. Family requests no monetary gifts or flowers. Donations can be made to Honpa Hongwanji Hilo Betsuin. She is survived by daughter, Mari (Dale) Vermeer of Hilo; brother, Les Ihara of Honolulu; brother-in-law, Raymond (Violet) Mimaki of Hawaii Kai, Oahu; three grandchildren; six great-grandsons, one great-great-grandson, numerous nieces and nephews. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Arthur Lehman

Arthur Carl Lehman, 93, of Mountain View died Dec. 19, 2022 at the Yukio Okutsu State Veterans Home. Born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, he was a retired automotive painter and detailer, a member of Aloha Independent Living and a veteran of the U.S. Air Force during the Korean War. Inurnment will take place at 9 a.m. Jan. 27 at the East Hawaii Veterans Cemetery #2. Casual attire. Survived by daughters, Kim (Kent) Olsen of Mountain View, Debora (Steve) Pedemonti of Winter Springs, Florida; four grandchildren, six great-grandchildren. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Gail Gesford

Gail Elaine Gesford, 68, of Pahala, died Dec. 17, 2022, at home. Born in Philadelphia, she was retired and a member of the Ocean View Church of Christ. Private services. She is survived by son, Jameson (Melissa) Gesford of Washington state; siblings, Janice Graham, Edward Gesford and David Gesford of Washington state; and two grandchildren. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.

Kenny Javar

Kenny Cortel Javar, 36, of Minot, North Dakota and formerly of Naalehu died Dec. 30, 2022 in Minot, North Dakota. Born in Pahala, he was the owner of H2O Images, a technician at Tires Plus in Minot, North Dakota and a veteran of the U.S. Air Force. Visitation will take place from 9:30–11 a.m. Jan. 28 at the Sacred Heart Catholic Church in Naalehu; funeral Mass at 11. Burial to follow at the Naalehu Community Cemetery. Casual attire. He is survived by wife, Jennifer Javar; children, Jaden Javar, Kellen Javar, Kaleah Javar, Makai Javar; parents, Reno &Josephine Javar; maternal grandmother, Caroline Cortel; siblings, Dr. Rose (Erich) Schroeder, Reyna Javar, Rey Javar; parents-in-law, Dennis &Sun Olson; brothers-in-law, Mike Olson, Dennis Olson, Jr.; a niece and numerous aunts, uncles, cousins and friends. Arrangements by Dodo Mortuary.
